{"step_by_step_thinking": "The contractile part of intrafusal fibers refers to the region of the fiber that is capable of contracting. Based on the provided documents, it is mentioned that the polar regions of the intrafusal muscle fibers contract, while the equatorial region does not contract because it has little contractile protein. Therefore, the contractile part of intrafusal fibers is the ends.", "answer_choice": "B. Ends"}
